title: (a)
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

The response must correctly identify both the profit-maximizing quantity and price to earn the point.

title: (b)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

The response identifies the price that would achieve the allocatively efficient quantity as P 1 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGqbWaaSbaaS qaaiaaigdaaeqaaaaa@3ABA@ .

title: (c)
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

The response must both state that producing the allocatively efficient quantity will not be economically feasible for the monopolist and explain why in order to earn the point.
descriptions: The response does not state no and/or does not explain that the regulated price is below the monopolist’s average total cost and it would be operating at a loss.

The response states no, producing the allocatively efficient quantity will not be feasible for the monopolist, and explains that the regulated price is below the monopolist’s average total cost and it would be operating at a loss.

title: (d)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not identify the price at which the monopolist would earn zero economic profit as P 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGqbWaaSbaaS qaaiaaikdaaeqaaaaa@3ABB@ .

title: (e)
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

The response must both state that the deadweight loss will decrease and explain why in order to earn the point.
descriptions: The response does not state that the deadweight loss will decrease or does not explain that this is because the price falls from the monopoly price, P 4 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGqbWaaSbaaS qaaiaaisdaaeqaaaaa@3ABD@ , to P 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGqbWaaSbaaS qaaiaaikdaaeqaaaaa@3ABB@ and the demand will be perfectly elastic up to the point where the price equals the demand curve.

The response states that the deadweight loss will decrease because the price falls from the monopoly price, P 4 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGqbWaaSbaaS qaaiaaisdaaeqaaaaa@3ABD@ , to P 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGqbWaaSbaaS qaaiaaikdaaeqaaaaa@3ABB@ and the demand will be perfectly elastic up to the point where the price equals the demand curve.
